title: Permissions error copying XCode on OSX when trying to install a package
body:
@mathstuf When using Spack on my OSX (10.11.6) laptop with XCode (8.1), and trying to install a package using Spack, it appears to copy the entire XCode directory into Spack and by default it appears I do not have the correct permissions for some folders:

==> Warning: Copying Xcode from /Library to /Users/jrood/spack/var/spack/stage/xcode-select/clang/8.0.0-apple in order to add spack wrappers to it. Please do not interrupt.
==> Error: Error: [('/Library/Application Support/Apple/ParentalControls/Users', '/Users/jrood/spack/var/spack/stage/xcode-select/clang/8.0.0-apple/Application Support/Apple/ParentalControls/Users', "[Errno 13] Permission denied:...............................
.............................
.............................

Is this just a configuration issue on my own laptop? I could probably change the permissions, but is it just possible to copy over just the XCode command line utils to accomplish the compiler wrapping?

jrood-laptop:ParentalControls jrood$ pwd
/Library/Application Support/Apple/ParentalControls
jrood-laptop:ParentalControls jrood$ ls -alh
total 0
drwxr-xr-x   4 root  wheel   136B Aug 27  2015 .
drwxr-xr-x  12 root  wheel   408B Dec  2  2015 ..
drwxr-xr-x   2 root  wheel    68B Aug 27  2015 ALRHelperJobs
drwx------   2 root  wheel    68B Aug 27  2015 Users
